Title: How British Destroyed Maratha Empire? | Anglo Maratha Wars | Dhruv Rathee
Description:
When the East India company was increasing its foothold and domination in the Indian subcontinent, it faced a big obstacle in the form of the great Maratha Empire. Maratha Empire started under the leadership of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj and was dominating the whole subcontinent by 1759. Hence, conflicts began between the East India Company and the Maratha Empire, which led to the Anglo-Maratha Wars. There were a total of three Anglo-Maratha Wars. Watch this video by Dhruv Rathee as he dives deep into how it all started and what led to the downfall of the Maratha Empire.

From chasing tech titles to building your own identity. Check: https://www.scaler.com/?utm_source=brandedcontent&utm_medium=Dhruvrathee&utm_campaign=brand_scaler_academy_brandedcontent_Dhruvrathee_branded-content-video-campaign-Dhruvrathee-22September2022_india_all&utm_content=YT-description

Amul is an emotion in India. It has become synonymous with dairy products. Amul not only did start a white revolution in India but also saved lakhs of farmers from exploitation. It is a brand that managed to get 40,000 Crores of Revenue. However, the story of Amul's inception is as interesting as its current business. Watch this video by Dhruv Rathee to find out how did Amul come into existence, and made India the largest producer of milk and milk products under the leadership of Verghes Kurien.

Description:
Tibet was always known to be a country of peace, centered around Buddhism until China invaded and took it over. The invasion was such that Dalai Lama, Tibet's head of the state and also the head of the religion had to flee from the country to save his life. But what is the full story of this invasion? Title: The Truth about Freebie Politics | Right or Wrong? | Dhruv Rathee

Freebies have now become a part of Indian politics. Free electricity, free water, free cycles, and other such things have become a part of everyone's political agenda. And how did freebies even begin in the first place? Do freebies really help the poor? Watch this video to find out as Dhruv Rathee explains the entire concept, pros, and cons of freebies.

Indus Valley Civilization is one of the biggest and oldest civilizations in the world. We have been taught about this topic in our schools a lot, but even after so much research, there are two mysteries that are to date unsolved related to it. First, how did it end? Title: Mystery of North Sentinel Island | The Last Stone Age Tribe in World |Â Dhruv Rathee
Description:
North Sentinel Island is one of those rare places on earth which are still very unknown. It is a small island part of the Andaman and Nicobar islands that are known for the people who live there- the Sentinelese Tribe. These are the people who still live as hunter-gatherers, and they don't even want to upgrade themselves. In fact, they attack anyone who tries to come close to their island. But how can an island be like this in a world where we are talking about life on Mars, going on the moon, metaverse, and what not? Watch this video to find out as Dhruv Rathee explains the mystery of North Sentinel Island and Sentinelese people in detail.

Title: Biggest Mystery in Aviation | What happened to MH370 Flight? | Dhruv Rathee
Description:
The disappearance of Malaysian Airlines Flight MH370 is one of the greatest aviation mysterious in the world. This flight was traveling from Kuala Lumpur to Beijing in 2014 but became a Mystery when the flight suddenly disappeared from the Radars, and no one was able to figure out where did it go even after spending millions of dollars in its investigation. But now, after 8 years, a person named Richard Godfrey has come up with a claim that he has sorted out the mystery. But what is the exact incident? Why is this such a big mystery? What all investigations were carried out? What theories are there? I talk about all these things in this video.

Title: Bulli Bai App | What is Root Cause of Radicalisation? | Sulli Deals | Dhruv Rathee
Description:

Title: How Banks Earn Money? |Â Business Model of Banks | Dhruv Rathee
Description:
Banks are often perceived as a money lending entity, but have you ever thought about how do Banks earn money? What is their Business Model? How do they provide you interest over your Deposits? Title: North Korea Bans Laughing! |Â Kim Jong Un | Dhruv Rathee
Description:
President and dictator Kim Jong Un has banned laughing, drinking, and even shopping in North Korea for 11 days as a part of mourning on the 10th anniversary of his father Kim Jong-il. People are not even allowed to cry out loud and take bodies to cremation if someone dies during this period. These rules might sound weird and funny to us, but this is a serious concern as the citizens of North Korea are brainwashed to the extent that they do not even know what's right and what's wrong. Watch this video where I explain these rules and why they are a problem in the 21st century.

Title: CDS Bipin Rawat Helicopter Crash | The Real Reason |Â Dhruv Rathee
Description:
In an unfortunate incident on 8th December, a military helicopter carrying general and cheif of defense staff Bipin rawat, his wife and 12 other passengers crashed near the hills of Coonoor Tamil Nadu. This was a modern Russian made Mi-17V5 model of helicopter which was going from Sunur to Wellington. It is used for advanced operations and also for professional use by Indian prime minister and the Indian president. Many people came up with theories on why this crash might have happened? Was it the bad machinery, pilot error or bad weather? In this video, I explain these theories and conclude which is the most likely one by comparing this with the famous basketball player Kobe Bryant helicopter crash of 2020.

Title: Carryminati, Munawar Faruqui and Kunal Kamra Controversy |Â Hinduphobia in Comedy | Dhruv Rathee
Description:
Recently, many stand-up comedy shows of Munawar Faruqui were cancelled due to alleged jokes on Hindi gods. Kunal Kamra's Bengaluru shows were also cancelled. In a third separate incident, famous YouTuber Carryminati (Ajey Nagar) had to clip a portion of his MeTube video which showed Ramayan characters. The accusations of Anti-Hinduness are growing every day. I explain and analyse this situation and compare it with Akshay Kumar's film and YouTuber Elvish Yadav. In this video, we will see how the whole Hinduphobia drama is simply a political gimmick.

Title: The Secret Business Model of Tesla | How Tesla earns Money? |Â Elon Musk | Dhruv Rathee
Description:
Tesla has become the most valuable car company in the world. It is more valuable than the next 10 car companies like Ford, Toyota, General Motors, Daimler, BMW and others combined. Its share price has increased exponentially to almost 15 times in the last two years as people invested more and more in the company. And yet the market share of Tesla is only around 2%. How is that possible? What profit margin does Tesla earn while selling the model 3, model X, model S and model Y cars? What are the revenue sources and how much money does Tesla actually make and spend on different things? I explain in this video. Also I explain the secret of Elon Muskâ€™s magic behind making Tesla a successful electric car company.

I also discuss the policy of governments all across the world banning flights and declaring lockdowns as a result of fear from Omicron strain.

Title: What if Nepotism Tax exists? | How Inheritance Tax Works | Dhruv Rathee
Description:
Imagine if there was a tax which could remove nepotism from society? A tax which is there during Inheritance. On similar grounds, There used to be the Estate duty in India.  As per this law, on the demise of a person, when his movable and immovable property was passed onto his or her heirs, an estate duty was levied. Inheritance tax and Estate duty are pretty much the same thing. Wealth tax and Gift tax are also related. n this video, I explain how can a potential inheritance tax be implemented and who will have to pay it? And is it even needed?

Description:
Indian stand-up comedian Vir Das did a show at the Kennedy Centre in USA. At the end of it, he recited a poem â€“ Two Indias, which was a social commentary about India. Showing a dichotomy â€“ on one side, the greatness of India, its culture, its philosophy, while on the other side, the grim realities of today. Many people said that they got goosebumps listening to this. They thanked Vir Das for speaking the truth, for exposing the grim reality. While there were many others who felt offended. In this video, I break down the logic behind this type of thought.

Title: Pandora Papers Explained | Money Trail of Super Rich People |Â Dhruv Rathee
Description:
Go to https://NordVPN.com/dhruv to get a 2-year plan at a huge discount plus 4 months free. Itâ€™s risk free with Nordâ€™s 30 day money-back guarantee!

Pandora Papers have shaken the financial world after Panama Papers. Many billionaires, top government heads of counties, celebrities and sportsperson are on this list like Anil Ambani, Putin and Sachin Tendulkar, but what exactly are they? They are a Financial data Leak which shows how the super rich people across the world avoid paying taxes. This comes at a time when taxes for common people keep rising and it gets harder and harder to pay them. Two years ago, a body called the International Consortium of Investigative Journalists (ICIJ) in Washington DC was given a secret tip which led to this. I explain the whole concept of how offshore accounts and money laundering allegedly works.

Title: What if Internet Crashes in the Whole World? |Â Dhruv Rathee
Description:
Itâ€™s not possible to cut the internet by cutting a few cables. Yes you can stop it in a few places, but on a large scale internet will not be possible to shut down. Thatâ€™s the advantage of decentralization of Internet. But what happened a few days ago was as close as it comes to that. Facebook, Whatsappp, Instagram all crashed for 5 hours. Combined 3 billion users. In this video, I talk about the history of the Internet, World Wide Web and the slow centralization of the web happening across the world.

Title: Did Mahatma Gandhi try to save Bhagat Singh? |Â Gandhi Jayanti Special |Â Dhruv Rathee
Description:
Mahatma Gandhi and Shaheed Bhagat Singh are often considered as a contrasting force to each other in todayâ€™s world. One stood for revolutionary acts, while other for peaceful, non-violent movements. But you will be surprised to know the connection between them. Many people think Gandhi made no attempt with Viceroy Irwin to save the life of Bhagat Singh, but what was the truth? In this video, I explain the historical events all the way from Kakori Train incident to Lahore Conspiracy case and the Parliament act of Bhagat Singh and his fellow freedom fighters. How did the trial of Bhagat Singh proceed? What speech did Netaji Subash Chandra Bose give in favor of Bhagat Singh? Know all in this Gandhi Jayanti special video.

Title: What is Quad? à¥¤ PM Modi in America à¥¤ Quad vs China à¥¤ Dhruv Rathee
Description:
Recently PM Modi went to America and met with Joe Biden, a trip which was once again deemed as historic by a certain section of Indian media. This trip was regarding the Quad summit, but what is the quad group? In this video, I explore the history of Quad group. India, US, Japan, Australia came together after 2004 tsunami for rescue effort. Then, former Indian PM met Japanese PM Shinzo Abe in 2006, and then, the idea of a grouping came into force. Nations which conform to an arc of freedom and prosperity. However, the group was deemed to be anti-china, and Australia pulled out after Kevin Rudd became Aussie PM. It was revived in 2017 when there was official level quad meet on sidelines of ASEAN regional forum in Manila. Now, Indian PM Narender Modi went to America for first leader level Quad meet.Â

Title: How Rwanda became No.1 Country of Africa | Ground Report by Dhruv Rathee

Title: Indira Gandhi's Emergency | Why it happened? | The Real Story | Dhruv Rathee
Description:
The first 1000 people to use the link below will get a free 1 month trial of Skillshare- 
https://skl.sh/dhruvrathee09211

The Emergency Period during Indira Gandhi regime is often regarded as dark days of Indian Democracy. But what was the actual reason behind Indira Gandhi proclaiming the emergency of 1975? In this mini-documentary, I go in depth to explain the root causes and reasons behind it. Starting from 1969 and the infamous battle between the legislative and judiciary to pass the privy purse laws and the nationalisation of banks laws.

Title: The 9/11 Attacks | What actually happened? | America | Dhruv Rathee
Description:
The morning of September 11th in America was quite unlike anything seen before. The events in USA were a world changing event. The World Trade Centre used to be an iconic building in New York, which collapsed. In total, there were a total of four different planes hijackings. United Airlines flight 93 is the most outstanding of those four since we saw an amazing heroic gesture. But the whole incident, permanently caused some changes across the world. In this mini- documentary video, I describe the sequences of events during the 9/11 and how these events changed the world forever.

Title: What if India has 0% Income Tax? | Dhruv Rathee
Description:
The abolition of Income tax is an idea which appeals to a lot of Indians. It may not be as unrealistic as it sounds since BJPâ€™s own Subramaniam Swamy is an active proponent of this. This is also a reality in many countries across the world. As many as 23 countries like UAE, Bermuda, Panama, Monaco donâ€™t have a personal income tax in their countries. Some donâ€™t even have corporate tax. How do these countries manage to earn revenue? What are the sources of income for their governments? I explain this hypothetical scenario and how India could potentially make zero income tax.

Title: Reality of Savarkar and Subash Chandra Bose | Partition 1947 | Dhruv Rathee
Description:
This video explores Indian history between 1920 to 1947 from the eyes of partitionists. Vinayak Damodar Savarkar, a key figure in our story was arrested by British and sent to kala paani. He is controversial for writing mercy petitions and a book on Hindutva. A political ideology based on religious divide and racism. On the other hand, this video talks about muslim nationalism too involving Rahmat Ali and Jinnah. How did the two nation theory come into being? What role did nationalists like Gandhi, Khan abdul gaffar khan, subhash chandra bose, bhagat singh play in this situation? What were Jinnah's letters to Churchill? And what was the Cabinet mission plan which would fragment india in several parts? Learn about the partition in this video.

Title: What is Socialism? |Â Ideologies of Gandhi, Nehru and Bhagat Singh |Â Dhruv Rathee
Description:
In this episode of 'Basics with Dhruv Rathee' series, learn in detail about the different ideas of socialism. An ideology which inspired multiple generations of Indian revolutionaries. 

Hirect is Indiaâ€™s 1st App-based hiring platform where you can chat directly with startup founders and CXOs as well as schedule your interview within minutes. With 30k+ startups already hiring on Hirect, What are you waiting for? 

Join Hirect today and take a step towards your dream job - 
https://hirect.page.link/rgZK 

Earlier socialism was defined as an economic system based on social interest. Rousseau and Proudhon argued for elimination of private property. Charles Fourier, Robert Owen advocated Utopian socialism, i.e. rich people be given moral values and they should share their wealth. Gandhi and Swami Vivekananda were inspired by such ideas. Karl Marx defined socialism as - from each as per his ability, to each as per his contribution. He saw it as an intermediate stage between capitalism and communism. Bhagat Singh was proponent of this revolutionary socialism. Fabian socialism was an ideology of Fabian society which talked about brining socialism through gradual reformist democratic measures. Jawahar Lal Nehru was a fabian socialist. Cooperative socialism implies socialization of means of production. John Meynard Keynes advocated that the government should organize and regulate the economic system, huge government spending so as to control recession, inequality, monopoly. In this video, I explain all such types of socialism.Â

Title: World's Most Expensive CurrencyÂ |Â Dhruv Rathee
Description:
What if I asked you which is the worldâ€™s most expensive currency? Considering that there are only a handful of so-called major currencies in the world, your guesses would include the US Dollar, Euro, Pound or even the Japanese Yen. However, the correct answer would be- The Kuwaiti Dinar or the KWD(its denomination). At the time of shooting this video, 1 Kuwaiti Dinar equals almost 250 Rupees! Why is that the case? How did the Kuwaiti Dinar become so valuable that it has outperformed even the USD (which makes up 60% of the forex reserves in the central banks across the world even today!)? And how does cryptocurrency like Bitcoin fit in terms of valuableness? I explain in todayâ€™s video.

Title: Partition 1947 à¥¤ Why it happened? | India and PakistanÂ | Dhruv Rathee
Description:
Indiaâ€™s Independence Day on 15th August 1947 was a landmark moment of happiness for millions. But the dark side of the moment was the Partition of country into India and Pakistan by Mountbatten Plan. What was the cause of this partition? Who caused the partition of 1947? Our story actually starts earlier than you might think. British started playing the policy of Divide and Rule after 1857 revolt shook the company rule. Pro-british Syed Ahmed Khan gave the two-nation theory in 1887 saying that the Hindus and Muslims are two different nations. I explain the role of Jinnah and the events till 1920s in this mini documentary.

Title: India's Best School? |Â Ep.2 Gems of India |Â Dhruv Rathee
Description:
Around 40 kms from the touristic city of Jaisalmer, lies a magical school. A school which has completely reimagined the way of teaching, building and training students. This is the Rajkumari Ratnavati School in Rajasthan. Built by an NGO called CITTA, it is a building made of sustainable materials, implementing the use of solar panels and rain water harvesting system along with traditional architectural style. This school provides free education to 400 below poverty line girls in one of the most backward regions of India in terms of female illiteracy and female unemployment.

Title: Rise of Taliban | Afghanistan Crisis Continued | US Troops Return | Dhruv Rathee
Description:
How did the Taliban come to power in Afghanistan? In this video, I explain the history of Afghanistan after the 1978 Saur Revolution, which saw the overthrow of Daoud Khan, and communist Noor Mohammad Taraki came to power. He was replaced by tyrant Hafizullah Amin. Then the Soviet Union intervened through Operation Storm 333 invading in Tajbeg palace. Communist leader Barbak Karmal was installed as new head. US CIA did covert Operation cyclone, and with Pakistan, Saudi Arabia, Britain, they indirectly supported the mujahideen.

Title: Mirabai Chanu | The Real Struggler |Â Tokyo Olympics 2021 | Inspiring | Dhruv Rathee
Description:
Saikhom Mira bai Chanu won a silver olympic medal in the ongoing Tokyo Olympics 2020 in the women's 49 kg weighlifting category. She thanked her mother and her coach Vijay Sharma. She lifted 87 kg in Snatch and 115 kg in Clean and Jerk segment totalling a score of 202 kg. Karnam Malleswari won a bronze olympic medal in 2000 Sydney Olympics in 69 kg category. She was the first Indian woman to win an olympic medal and first Indian to win a medal for weightlifting. Here I tell the inspiring story of Mirabai Chanu from being a village girl of Manipur's Nongpok Kakching village to winning an olympic medal.

Title: Pegasus Spyware | How Pegasus hacks your phone? | Israel NSO | Dhruv Rathee
Description:
Go to https://NordVPN.com/dhruv and use code DHRUV to get a 2-year plan plus 4 additional months with a huge discount. Itâ€™s risk free with Nordâ€™s 30 day money-back guarantee!

Recently France based organization Forbidden StoriesÂ and Amnesty International laid their hands on a leaked list of 50000 phone numbers, which were targets or potential targets of snooping by Pegasus, which is a spyware built by Israel company NSO group. These revelations were made open to the world by 17 media organizations in 10 countries, like The Guardian, The Washington Post, Le Monde and Indian news portal The Wire. The list included 300 Indians - politicians like Rahul Gandhi, Abhishek Banerjee, Prashant Kishore, many activists and journalists like Rohini Singh, Vijaita Singh. BJP-headed Indian government has denied allegations of snooping. Herein I explain this issue of the Pegasus Project.Â

Title: Rabindranath Tagore | How a School Drop-Out Won the Nobel Prize | Dhruv Rathee
Description:
The man who wrote the national anthems of India and Bangladesh was a school dropout, but how did he go on to win a Nobel Prize? This is Rabindranath Tagore's short biography in Hindi. His father Debendranath Tagore's spiritual journey to Shantiniketan, Golden Temple Amritsar and Dalhousie hill station in Himalayas, where he learnt the Ramayan, Upanishads, astronomy, Kalidas poems. The translation of his poems Gitanjali made him popular and he won Nobel Prize. In this video, I throw a light on his life.Â Â Â

Title: Cabinet Reshuffle of Modi Government | Good or Bad? | New Cabinet Ministers | Dhruv Rathee
Description:
The Central government is headed by NDA, which is an alliance of BJP. Since 2019, they are in power. Now Narendra Modi did a cabinet reshuffle of his cabinet. 43 ministers took oath, in which there were 36 new ministers. Home Minister Amit Shah, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, External Affairs Minister Subramanyam Jaishankar and Defence Minister Rajnath Singh retained their posts. Ravi Shankar Prasad, Prakash Javadekar, Santosh Gangwar were made to step down. There were new faces like Ashwini Vaishnaw as Railway Minister, Minister of Electronics & IT, and communications. Anurag Thakur as Youth Affairs Minister. 7 new women in cabinet.

Title: Extreme Heatwave in Canada | 50Â°C Temperature |Â Climate Change | Dhruv Rathee
Description:
As unbelievable as it sounds, a village for lytton in the state of British Columbia in Canada registered a record breaking temperature of almost 50Â°C last week. The fact that this comes as a big surprise is because Canada is one of the coldest countries on planet. Experts blame a heat dome as the reason behind this but the real cause is climate change. I explain how the extreme weather patterns are increasing in all parts of the world because of this, which means summers will become hotter and winters will become colder. And what can we do to stop the climate change?

Title: Swami Vivekananda |Â How Naren became a Monk! |Â Dhruv Rathee
Description:
Swami Vivekananda was a great spiritual leader. He is a source of motivation and inspiration for all Indians since he popularised Hinduism, Ayurveda and Yoga in the western world. His speech at world parliament of religions in Chicago resonated in America. Narendranath Datta was born in Bengal, studied at Metropolitan Institute (Vidyasagar College), Presidency college, Scottish Church College. He was inspired by Raja Rammohan Roy, Brahmo Samaaj, Western esotericism, freemasonry, transcendentalism. He saw his spiritual teacher in Ramkrishna Paramhansa. Here I tell the story of how Narendranath Dutta became Swami Vivekananda.

Title: Mystery of Mehul Choksi |Â Uncle of Nirav Modi | Explained by Dhruv Rathee
Description:
Indian fugitive Mehul Choksi, who is also the uncle of Nirav Modi had escaped to Antigua and Barbuda four years ago after his name surfaced in the infamous PNB Scam. He was accused of taking a loan of thousands of crores from the bank and never repaying the money. He used the golden visa programme to get the citizenship. He has recently being in the news again as he was found mysteriously missing from Antigua and in the country of Dominica. Antiguan PM has been trying to extradite him back to India as he accuses him of having links with opposition politicians in Dominica. I explain this mystery and different allegations in this video.

Title: The Problem with GDP | How India's GDP works? | Dhruv Rathee
Description:
Latest GDP Growth Data reveals that India has seen the worst ever GDP Growth since independence in 1947. This is the new data for the FY 2020-21, I explain what all are the other predictions and findings of this. I also explain this hidden truth behind GDP. What does GDP as an indicator hide from us about country's ground reality? Is it a good indicator for measuring progress and economic development after all? Since it ignores inequality and happiness as measures of progress.

Title: Lakshadweep in DangerÂ | What is happening? | Praful Patel | Dhruv Rathee
Description:
Lakshadweep islands are India's smallest union territory but they encompass a huge amount of biodiversity and wildlife in them. So much so that Andaman and Nicobar Islands and Lakshadweep islands are the only places in India which are classified as HOPE spots. They are also the place with the lowest crime rate and one of the highest literacy rates in India. Everything was peaceful until a new Lakshadweep administrator Praful K Patel was appointed by the President and things went bad. What exactly were the decisions that he took? I explain in this video along with the administrative structure of Lakshadweep.

Title: Israel Palestine Conflict: 1000 year History | Jerusalem | Gaza | West Bank |  Dhruv Rathee
Description:
How was the country of Israel born? When did Palestine came into being? In this video, I explain in detail the complete history of Israel - Palestine conflict which dates back to before the Ottoman empire. In 1917, the British promised Jews a separate country in the Balfour declaration. In 1947, the United Nations released a partition plan after which Israel first came into existence and immediately went to war in 1948 with the neighbouring Arab countries. Why did Israel and Palestine came so close to achieving peace in 1993? From the year 1000s to year 2021, this video takes you through the complete history of the region.

Title: COVID Home Treatment |Â Oxygen Procedure | Remdesivir vs Other Medicines | Dhruv Rathee
Description:
What can you do if all the hospital beds are full and you cannot find a place? You might be forced to do COVID-19 treatment at home for your family / relatives who are suffering from Coronavirus. In this video, I explain the step by step procedure of home isolation treatment for COVID-19. Which steroids can you use for treatment and which ones like Remdesivir to avoid? What are the most effective techniques to increase your oxygen saturation?

All the information in this video has been compiled by a team of professional doctors based in Vellore. I still highly recommend that you consult a doctor / nurse at least once before implementing the techniques mentioned in this video since your previous health conditions may cause undesired side effects from some steroids. Although this information is up to date with the best of current knowledge, apply this in your home at your own risk.

Title: The Mystery of Anglo Indians | Dhruv Rathee
Description:
Did you know that the British East India Company promoted marriages between Britishers and Indians during the 1600s? This gave rise to a lesser known community in India known as the Anglo Indians. I explain their history, their rise, how they fought against the oppression by British and how they went on to get reservation in the parliament of India.

Title: Farmers Protest & Red Fort Incident |Â Deep Sidhu |Â Rakesh Tikait | Ghazipur Border | Dhruv Rathee
Description:
On 26th January, thousands of farmers across India participated in a peaceful Tractor Parade. Delhi Police gave them permission to do the same on pre-designated routes next to the Singhu border, Ghazipur border and Tikri border. But some tractors went off the path and suddenly things took a turn for the worse. A group of people entered Red Fort and Nishan Sahib Flag Hoisting happened on it. A Man named Deep Sidhu takes responsibility for it. I explain the sequence of events and who should be held responsible in this case.

Title: Did Caste Reservations destroy India? | Dhruv Rathee ft. @sochbymm
Description:
Have reservations improved the life of lower castes in India? In this video, we will use research published by eminent scholars to understand the impact of caste reservations on lives of SC, ST and OBC.

0:00 Introduction
0:56 Outputs vs outcomes
2:42 Reservations in education
5:04 Reservations in government jobs
6:51 Outcomes of reservation
9:34 Why reservations are not enough?
10:37 Solutions to reduce discrimination!
13:37 Are Reservations against Merit?

****************
Script by: Sushmita Sekhar
Editing by: Ayushman Khare
****************
Sources

1. Outputs vs outcomes
https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/politics-and-nation/over-9-crore-toilets-constructed-under-swachh-bharat-kovind/articleshow/67773723.cms#:~:text=NEW%20DELHI%3A%20Under%20the%20Swachh,increased%20to%2098%20per%20cent.

2. Output: Representation in education institutes
https://www.jstor.org/stable/4415591?read-now=1&seq=6
https://www.jstor.org/stable/4415591?refreqid=excelsior%3Af9b6d2765a90a68754ddd4b3ca737ed7&seq=1
https://www.aeaweb.org/articles?id=10.1257/aer.20140783

3. Output: Representation in govt administeration
https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/politics-and-nation/sc/sts-fail-to-break-caste-ceiling-no-sc-in-149-top-government-officers-40-pc-do-menial-jobs/articleshow/16278743.cms
https://www.news18.com/news/india/quota-helped-bridge-education-gap-by-40-new-research-finds-it-pushes-school-students-for-higher-studies-2804229.html
https://persmin.gov.in/DOPT/Brochure_Reservation_SCSTBackward/Ch-01_2014.pdf
http://ftp.iza.org/dp13847.pdf
https://dpe.gov.in/sites/default/files/Reservation_Brochure-2.pdf
https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0305750X14001521

4. Outcomes
http://ftp.iza.org/dp13847.pdf
https://uh.edu/~achin/research/w16509.pdf
https://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.197.8597&rep=rep1&type=pdf
http://www.econ.cam.ac.uk/people-files/faculty/si105/Jobs%20ReservationDAC.pdf
https://www.mitpressjournals.org/doi/pdf/10.1162/rest_a_00848
http://www.simonchauchard.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/02/APSR2014.pdf

Title: How Farmers Bills passed Rajya Sabha! | Dhruv Rathee
Description:
On September 20th, Rajya Sabha passed the controversial farmers bills. But the way it was done raises serious questions about the functioning of Indian Parliamentary Democracy. The speaker did a voice vote when many Rajya Sabha Members were raising constantly demanding a division vote. I explain in this video what voice vote, division vote is and what happened on the day. Many MPs including Derek O Brien and Sanjay Singh were suspended from the Rajya Sabha after this. With opposition boycotting the Raja Sabha, the govt went on to pas 15 bills without any consensus in the past 2 days.

Title: Lebanon Crisis: Entire Govt Resigns | Explained by Dhruv Rathee
Description:
The country of Lebanon has a very unique political system owing to its religious demographics which make up approximately 27% Sunni Muslims, 27% Shia Muslims and 21% Maronite Christians. The rule is such that the president of the country always has to be a Maronite Christian, the speaker of the parliament must always be a Shia Muslim and the Prime Minister must be a Sunni Muslim. This sectarian devision has caused a lot of conflicts in the country and eventually plunged the country into unprecedented economic crisis.

Title: Why Assam Floods Every Year?Â | Assam Floods 2022 | Dhruv Rathee
Description:
Year after year it is the same story. Millions of people get displaced in Assam and other north east indian states due to floods, precious human and animal lives are lost. In this video, I analyse the reason behind why these Assam floods happen. Since 1950, there have been 12 major floods, but in recent years the frequency of the floods have increased drastically. Deforestation in the Brahmaputra area, encroachment of floodplains, location of Assam, poor maintenance of embankments and climate change are a few of the reasons. I will specially focus on climate change and embankments in this video. Embankments are also called Levee or Dykes. I explain what they are, the problem with them and the solutions while talking up the Netherlands as a case study.

2:58 Impact of Climate Change 
5:08 What is Embankment?
6:42 Embankment Breaching
8:16 Downsides of Embankments 
9:32 Netherlands Case Study 
11:24 Solutions

Title: How EIA 2020 will Damage India! | Dhruv Rathee
Description:
The new EIA draft notification threatens to destroy all the remaining rules and system which have been in place for the protection of Indian environment and biodiversity. In this video, I explain why and how exactly it will do that. We have time till 11th August 2020 to send suggestions to Environment Ministry to stop this draft from being introduced as a law. 

Send your suggestions to eia2020-moefcc@gov.in

f you want some help trying to draft your own suggestions, you can visit this link - https://linktr.ee/LetIndiaBreathe

Few of the reasons why this law is problematic - 
- It offers Post Facto clearance to projects 
- Public consultations have been removed from many categories of projects
- Fragile coasts and flood defender mangroves will opened up for exploitation

Title: India vs China Border | Explained by Dhruv Rathee
Description:
Has China really intruded into the Indian Territory in Ladakh? The answer depends on which country's political map do you use and whose claim do you consider. There are conflicting reports by various experts on this because the Indian Govt has not officially released any statement on it. In this video, I report what various retired army officers have been saying from their sources and interview retired colonel Ajai Shukla for his opinion on this current India-China border dispute. The current issue is happening at three different places- Pangong lake in Ladakh, Galwan river valley and hot springs near kongka pass. I also explain the basics of LOC (Line of control) and LAC (Line of actual control) and the different claim lines of India and China in this video. 

Relevant Sources for more information - 
Newslaundry Explanatory article (https://www.newslaundry.com/2020/06/02/confused-about-the-indo-china-conflict-in-ladakh-read-this)
Lt.Gen.Panagâ€™s Article (https://theprint.in/opinion/indias-fingers-have-come-under-chinese-boots-denial-wont-help-us/435145/)
Indiaâ€™s officially statement on Meeting (https://mea.gov.in/press-releases.htm?dtl/32746/IndiaChina+meeting+of+Army+Commanders+on+June+06+2020)

Title: Locust Attack in India | Explained by Dhruv Rathee
Description:
Since December Locust swarms have been destroying crops all over East Africa and now they have reached Pakistan and India. Locusts are insects which belong to the same family as crickets and grasshoppers. They grow in isolation (solitary phase) but lack of rain can push individual locusts to grow. And in high densities, they undergo a phase change to the gregarious phase. This changes their habits, behavior, appearance and causes swarms to build up, which destroy agriculture crops across the world. In this video, I explain these details about locusts, their swarms and solutions to fight against them. 

Relevant Sources: 

https://www.nationalgeographic.com/animals/invertebrates/group/locusts/
https://scroll.in/article/963175/pakistans-solution-to-the-locust-invasion-is-to-turn-the-pests-into-chicken-feed

Title: India vs Nepal Border Dispute | Explained by Dhruv Rathee
Description:
Few days ago, Nepal published a new political map of their country that includes a small stretch of land controlled by India. It is approximately 300 square kilometers of land located between Limpiyadhura, Lipulekh and Kalapani which Nepal believes to be a part of its own country. In this video, I take you through the history of this land, how borders were divided between India and Nepal through the Sugauli Treaty and how this dispute has arisen. I also explain role of China's influence in this geopolitics.

Title: The Problem with Arnab Goswami | Opinion by Dhruv Rathee
Description:
Arnab Goswami recently got into a controversy after his latest debate on his 9pm show. After which he had FIRs being filed against him and on 27th April, he was questioned by the Mumbai Police for over 12 hours. His supporters say that he is being targeted for speaking against Sonia Gandhi and this is against freedom of speech. His critics say that he deserves this. In this video, I present my opinion on Arnab Goswami, his channel Republic TV and this current issue of freedom of speech. Is his freedom of speech really being violated or should it be considered as hate speech? 

According to DangerousSpeech.org website, there's 5 things that are important to consider when drawing the line between free speech
1. Speaker: Did the message come from influential speaker?
2. Audience: Are the listeners already fearful so they are more suspectful?
3. Message: What kind of elements does the message carry?
4. Context: Is there any historical or social context which makes division more likely?
5. Medium: How influential is the medium? Is it the primary source of news for that audience?

Title: Saudi-Russia Oil Price Crash | Explained by Dhruv Rathee
Description:
In the past few weeks, Oil Prices have crashed from around $60 a barrel down to almost $20 a barrel. This is not only a big deal for global economy, geopolitics but also environment. Almost every countryâ€™s economy is affected by this, either positively or negatively. The big reason for this is the falling global demand and the oil price war between Russia, USA and Saudi Arabia. The three biggest producers of Oil. Saudi Arabia is a part of OPEC (Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries) which together control the supply of oil to regulate the price in the market. Russia did an agreement with Saudi which was popularly known as OPEC+ but the talks broke down after Russia refused to decrease the supply of oil. This will impact the US Shale Oil businesses which may go bankrupt. It is a big profit for oil importing countries like India and Japan which will save them billions of dollars.

Title: Indian Economy Crisis in 2020 | Analysis by Dhruv Rathee
Description:
Modi Govt ministers kept telling us that Indian economic slowdown is happening because of the global slowdown. But, IMF Chief Econoimst has now openly said that global slowdown is happening because of Indian economic slowdown. The projected GDP growth for 2019 year has been further downgraded to just 4.8%. At this rate India will not reach the $5 trillion economy goal even by 2030. So what is the solution? How can Indian economy be revived? Title: India's Best Statue | Ground Report by Dhruv Rathee
Description:
In this ground report from Trivandrum, Kerala, I visit the Jatayu Earth Center. Undoubtedly the Best Statue in India and perhaps the best tourist place in India which has been recently made. You will see what makes this tourist place so unique and special in this video. It is 100% privately funded at a cost of â‚¹100 crores only by multiple NRI investors. It is made on a BOT - Build, Operate, Transfer model according to which the tourist site will be given to government after 30 years. Apart from this unique business model, this is also an eco-tourism site. I interview its sculptor Rajiv Anchal in this video.

Title: Inside World's Smallest "Country" | Ground Report by Dhruv Rathee
Description:
In this ground report, I explore the most unique country in the world. Located inside Australia, Principality of Hutt River is a country with a population of only 23 people. It was founded by just one person (Leonard Casley) after disagreements with the Australian government and his own family is the only one that lives there. I interview his son to ask about the legitimacy of a nation. It will make you question the concept of a nation and how it is defined!

Title: Reality of Chandrayaan 2 Moon Mission | Explained by Dhruv Rathee
Description:
Yesterday was the 50th anniversary of humanity's moon landing, the day on which Neil Armstrong became the first human to step on the moon. Today, India is launching the historic Chandrayaan 2 mission which will make India only the fourth country to have landed on the moon and the first in the space race to reach the south pole. In this video, i explain why south pole is so important and how the search for water on moon has progressed in the past decade. Water exists in the form of ice in the shadowed region of craters on the moon.

Attention: There are two factual errors in the video as follows- 
1. The lander's touchdown date is September 6/7, not September 19
2. Gaganyaan does not aim to send humans to the Moon. It's only about launching an Indian crew to low-Earth orbit for seven days. ISRO has not announced any plans yet to send humans to the Moon.

Title: Reality of AN 32 Aircraft Crash | Analysis by Dhruv Rathee
Description:
The missing IAF Aircraft AN 32 has finally being found after 8 days of constant search. As expected, it was not taken by aliens but had crashed. This is the third such incident regarding AN 32 aircraft in the past 10 years. AN 32 is an airplane for mainly transporting stuff by the Ukraine company Antonov. India had purchased 100 such planes from Ukraine in 1985. In this video, I explore the reasons behind why these incidents keep occurring and what is the root cause of it?

Credits: This research and guidance for this video was provided by an IAF Wing Commander

Title: Cleaning 9 million kgs of Trash | Dhruv Rathee Interviews Afroz Shah
Description:
For this Ground Report, I went to Versova Beach in Mumbai, where the World's Largest Beach Cleanup took place. Be ready to get inspired as I interview Afroz Shah, the man who was singlehandedly responsible for this mega cleanup. He was designated with the United Nations 'Champion of the Earth' award for his remarkable work. He will give you social, psychological, motivational and technical advice on how you can do the same for your society, for your country and for our planet Earth. Learn waste management and garbage management basics. Don't forget to see the upcoming Champion Challenge at the end of this video. Specific details on the Champion Challenge will be given in the next video. Special Credits for filming: A One Digital Entertainment Production

Some of the practical advice given in this video on managing garbage - 
- Don't buy items in shiny packaging 
- Always recycle milk packets by collecting them and giving to kabadiwala 
- Use your own reusable water bottles
- Compost your wet, biodegradable garbage (More on this later)
- Find Recycling Centers, Landfills near you.

Title: Reality of Modi's Varanasi after 5 years | Ground Report by Dhruv Rathee
Description:
After 5 years of Modi's rule, how has Varanasi changed? Is it more cleaner? Has the Vikas finally reached here? I go on ground in this 20 min documentary to investigate and show you the reality. I will show you people's opinions, cleaning of ghats, cleaning of Ganga, the Kashi Vishwanath Corridor and Modi's adopted village. A few kilometres from Varanasi lies the Model Village of Jayapur. It was adopted by Narendra Modi in 2014 under the Saansad Adarsh Gaon Yojna. The condition is shocking to say the least. Roads, Schools, Drainage, Toilets, Solar Panels are all in a bad shape. Health care centres / Hospitals, skill centres, schools above class 5 are completely missing. Ironically, this village was also adopted by RSS in 2002 under the ideal village scheme.

Title: BJP vs Congress: Which Manifesto is Better? | Analysis by Dhruv Rathee
Description:
I review and analyse the BJP manifesto for 2019 lok sabha elections. Then, I compare it to the Congress Manifesto to judge which is better for India. The whole document is 44 page long with multiple promises being made. But I will only talk about the promises which are specifically stated, easy to measure or have a given deadline. I divided the different promises in the manifesto in four different categories, based on how easy or difficult is it to implement them and how much we need them, for long term development of India. Here are the four different categories

1:28 Most needed promises that are easy to implement
2:35 Most needed promises that are difficult to implement 
4:34 Improbable promises 
7:02 Unclear / Bad Promises
8:24 Which manifesto is better? 

Link to full manifesto: 
BJP- https://www.bjp.org/manifestoPDF/BJP-Election-english-2019.pdf
INC- https://manifesto.inc.in/pdf/english.pdf

Title: Should Voting be Compulsory? | Analysis by Dhruv Rathee
Description:
Everyone has the right to vote in our country. But what would happen if this right to vote became a duty and it became compulsory to vote? You will be surprised to know that this is how it works across many countries in the world! I analyze the different countries across the world, where right to vote started, how it was selective at first and later, how it is compulsory in some. Get a world wide view of voting across democracies!

Title: Andh Bhakt Banerjee Debates with Dhruv Rathee | Logical Fallacies Explained!
Description:
See the most educational and entertaining debate in India, where Dhruv Rathee debates with Andh Bhakt Banerjee (ft. Akash Banerjee). Learn about the various kinds of flaws in reasoning, which are also known as logical fallacies. I explain 7 most common forms of logical fallacies and arguments you see in speeches and debates - 

1- Strawman Argument
2- Slippery Slope
3- Loaded Question
4- False Dichotomy
5- Circular Argument
6- Red Herring
7- Ad Hominem

Title: Reality of 10% Reservation for Economically Weak: New Jumla? | Opinion by Dhruv Rathee
Description:
Union cabinet on Monday approved 10% reservation in jobs and educational institutions for economically weak sections in general category. This will be given over and above the existing 50% reservation. In this video, I will tell you why I think this new scheme is nothing but a Jumla and a Lollipop to appease voters. The data suggests that more than 90% of general category people are eligible for being â€˜Economically weakâ€ and poor according to new criterion (based on my assumptions). So the question arises here, will the real poor people even benefit from this? What is the point of this new reservation? Ironically, people sill have to pay income tax despite being eligible under this category. Sources: https://www.thehindubusinessline.com/economy/budget/only-76-lakh-indians-showed-income-of-over-rs-5-lakh-jaitley/article9514752.ecehttps://www.thehindu.com/news/national/obc-creamy-layer-income-limit-raised-to-8-lakh-per-annum/article19677545.ecel

Title: 2.0 - Science behind Rajnikanth 's Movie | Mobile Phone Radiation Explained by Dhruv Rathee
Description:
Rajnikanth and Akshay Kumar's Robot 2.0 movie has become a big blockbuster. This movie is built around the theme of cellphone tower and mobile phone radiation impacting the population of birds in India. In this video, I will explore the scientific accuracy of this claim. Do cellphone towers emit radiation? If yes, how harmful is it to birds and humans? Should we stop using our smartphones and cellphones? I explain the concept of Electromagnetic waves, ionising and non-ionising radiation and wildlife and bird conservation.

Title: India under Modi Govt | 4 years of Performance Rankings Analyzed by Dhruv Rathee
Description:
This video is a comprehensive analysis of India's development under Modi government. I compare various rankings and indexes of India in 2014 with year 2018. This comparison tells us how India, as a country has performed in fields like Business,  Environment, Human Development, Happiness etc. in the past 4 years. The following parameters have been analysed - 

1. Ease of doing Business 0:10
2. Human Development Index (HDI)1:35
3. Environmental Performance Index (EPI) 3:02
4. Happiness Index 4:16
5. Global Hunger Index (GHI) 5:56
6. World Press Freedom Index 6:45
7. Global Competitiveness Index (GCI) 7:55
8. Global Democracy Index 9:04

Title: Vijay Mallya: Who helped him Escape? | Analysis by Dhruv Rathee
Description:
Finance Minister Arun Jaitley met Vijay Mallya before leaving India according to them. This one statement has revealed many hidden details and secrets in this case and raised some very important questions. But this controversy became one more issue where BJP and Congress have started blaming each other. This video breaks apart the whole Vijay Mallya issue so you can get closer to understanding who is actually responsible for his escape and who should be blamed. I present solutions to this whole issue at the end also. Relevant dates of the events - 29 July 2015: CBI files FIR against Vijay Mallya 
16 October 2015: CBI release look out notice to detain Mallya
24 November 2015: CBI downgrades the look out notice
28 February 2016: Senior Supreme Court Lawyer Dushant Dave warns State Bank of India that Mallya is about to leave the country
01 March 2016: Alleged meeting between Arun Jaitley and Mallya 
02 March 2016: Vijay Mallya escapes India 
12 March 2016: CBI says first look out notice was a mistake
12 September 2018: Mallya reveals he met Finance Minister

Title: Kerala Floods: Can future disasters be prevented? |Â Ft. Poojan Sahil and Dhruv Rathee
Description:
Well renowned ecologist and scientist predicted a flood in the western ghats back in 2013. He recommended environment conservation efforts to prevent illegal construction, stone mining and quarrying. Can doing all those things prevent Kerala floods in the future?

HOW TO CONTRIBUTE:
Directly to the CMDRF:
Money can be contributed through cheque or online transfer. Details for both on this link:  https://donation.cmdrf.kerala.gov.in/

For every non-corporate ride you take on Ola, Rs 5 gets added to the CM's Relief Fund. 

Zomato has tied up with the Akshaya Patra foundation, all contributions will go towards food for the flood victims
Open the zomato app
Click on "order food online"
Click on the blue "Help Kerala" tab on the top left
Select how many meals you want to donate
Proceed to online payment to complete donation 

Amazon 
Go to the amazon app or amazon.in
Click on the "kerala needs your help" section
Select one out of three listed NGOs - Habitat for Humanity, Goonj, World Vision India
From the given list of products, select the ones you want to donate
Select a gift registry address for delivery
Proceed to payment to complete donation

Decathlon - Many decathlon stores are serving as drop-off centres for donating pre-owned clothes. Check if your nearest Decathlon is a centre, and donate
Go to www.keralarescue.in to find out how to register as volunteer, and to get detailed updates on what items are needed in what quantity. 

Use Google Person Finder to locate a missing person or add information about a missing person

Go to https://milaap.org/fundraisers/kerala... to contribute to the crowdfunding campaign to raise funds, led by Asha,a development consultant working with leading non profits in India for over 15 years, and a co-founder of Rapid Response, India's leading disaster relief organisation.. The funds raised here will be used to distribute 300 relief kits, 300 bed kits and 300 kitchen sets. In total they aim to support 900 families.

Visit https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/0/vie... to view a consolidated and pin-dropped a list of centres providing rescue ops, including shelters, food and water, medicine and essentials, volunteers, Jeep rescue and ambulances, among others, put out and updated by Google.

Title: Atal Bihari Vajpayee: Best PM of India? | Analysis by Dhruv Rathee
Description:
Former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee is no more. In this video, I do an analysis of the achievements of his government from 1999 - 2004. The milestones that India achieved under him are impressive to say the least, which is why it not an understatement to put Atal Bihari Vajpayee under one of the best PMs (Prime Ministers) India has ever seen. The main focus of this video is five areas - Education, Science, Foreign Policy, Economy and Infrastructure and his Personality. Please keep in mind that this is only an analysis of the achievements and positive points of Atal Bihari Vajpayee, but obviously he had many negatives also. You can see that in Vinod Dua ji's video.

Title: Photoshopped Videos created using Artificial Intelligence!! | Explained by Dhruv Rathee
Description:
We have reached a point in technology, where it is possible to create anything, make anyone say anything in a high resolution video. Till now, this was done in movies using long and complicated process of CGI. But now it is possible for anyone to do it in a matter of minutes sitting at home thanks to advancements in artificial intelligence. I explain machine learning and neural networks in brief here apart from explaining how these Artificial intelligence generated synthetic videos can be created. I also discuss the implications of this technology along with solutions on how we can counter it.

Title: Kejriwal vs LG: What is happening in Delhi? | Explained by Dhruv Rathee
Description:
In this video, learn about the recent ongoing crisis between the Delhi government, LG of Delhi, IAS officers association and the Centre government. 

Delhi chief minster Arvind Kejriwal claims that Modi government has pressurised the IAS officers to go on a strike and stop going to all meetings to stop the development work in Delhi. Some IAS Officers on Twitter and the IAS Association in a press conference say that they are not on any strike and they are attending all the meetings of the government. Who is lying and who is saying the truth? Find our in this video.

Title: Exclusive Interview of an Indian Soldier with Dhruv Rathee | Ground Reality of Indian Jawan
Description:
What harsh conditions do our indian jawans have to experience? What problems are they facing, which force them to retire or end their life? What is their opinion of the government and growing nationalism in the country?  Listen right from the heart of an Indian Jawan, who has served in the SSB paramilitary defence forces for over 23 yrs. Title: Machu Picchu 2017, Peru | Travel Wonders of World by Dhruv Rathee
Description:
This is a video of my recent travel trip to South america's most popular attraction Machu Picchu. More than 7,000 feet above sea level in the Andes Mountains, Machu Picchu is the most visited tourist destination in South America and Peru. A symbol of the Incan Empire and built around 1450AD, Machu Picchu was designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1983 and was named one of the New Seven Wonders of the World in 2007.

Title: Truth behind EVM Machine Hacking | Electronic Voting Fraud in India by Dhruv Rathee
Description:
In the Uttar Pradesh State Elections in India, the BJP won by a historic record breaking margin of 325 seats. This has bought forward the issue of Election fraud in EVM (Electronic Voting) machines. EVMs can be hacked and tampered easily. That's why most developed nations do not use an EVM.

Sign Petition: https://www.change.org/p/election-commission-of-india-bring-back-the-ballot-paper-and-stop-using-evms-in-elections

Learn more in the following international news about EVM- 

0- Research paper on Security analysis of Indian EVM by University of Michigan 
https://indiaevm.org/evm_tr2010-jul29.pdf

1- Indian made EVM in Botswana are susceptible to vote rigging 
http://www.sundaystandard.info/mooted-voting-machine-has-caught-flak-all-angles

2- Electronic Voting Machines & Why Voters Should Be Suspicious Of Every Election
http://www.zerohedge.com/news/2016-05-30/electronic-voting-machines-why-voters-should-be-suspicious-every-election

3- Netherlands Bans EVM in 2008
http://www.theregister.co.uk/2008/05/20/dutch_ban_on_voting_computers/

3b- Germany bans EVM in 2009
https://trustthevote.org/2009/09/02/electronic-voting-banned-in-germany/

4- American research describing how easy is it to hack voting machines
http://www.salon.com/2011/09/27/votinghack/

5- Prevent fraud by Banning EVM
https://forcechange.com/21535/prevent-election-fraud-by-banning-electronic-voting-machines/

6- Why are states dumping EVM to go back to paper (America)
http://www.theblaze.com/news/2012/11/01/why-are-some-states-dumping-their-electronic-voting-machines-and-going-back-to-paper/

7- Dr David Dill speaks on Indian EVM
http://vimeo.com/9503780

Title: The Island of Birds: Islas Ballestas, Paracas, Peru
Description:
The Ballistas Islands are situated in the southern coast of Peru, near the city of Pisco. They're rich in marine life, home to sea lions, pelicans, Peruvian boobies and Humboldt penguins ye uninhabited by humans. With over tens of thousands of birds on the island, it's a bird watcher's paradise. 

I was busy this week, didn't have much time to research a lot. So here's a short video from my recent trip. Next video will be an informational video.
